title: No, this video doesn’t show an aircraft cabin on Air India flight
subtitle: The aircraft does not belong to Air India. It was filmed on Saudia Airlines flight from Jeddah in Saudi Arabia to Addis Ababa in Ethiopia.
author: factly.in
vclaim:
“Air India flight with hajis. We can only sympathise with the cabin crew”, claims a Facebook post that enclosed a video that shows disgusting condition of an aircraft cabin. Let’s try to analyze the claim made in the post.

Claim: The video showing the disgusting condition of an aircraft cabin travelled by persons with skull caps is on Air India flight. Fact: The footage was filmed on Saudia Airlines flight from Jeddah in Saudi Arabia to Addis Ababa in Ethiopia. Hence, the claim that it is an Air India flight stands FALSE.

When the video in the post is run through ‘InVid’ plugin, several keyframes were returned. On subjecting these keyframes to Google Reverse Image Search technique, a certain keyframe directed to an article of “Gulf Business” newspaper. As per this article, this incident has taken place on an inaugural flight from Jeddah in Saudi Arabia to Addis Ababa in Ethiopia. This flight belonged to Saudia Airlines (also known as Saudi Arabia Airlines).

When searched with keywords to find reports on this incident by any other news agencies, an article of “Daily Mail” was found. In this article, a video was also included and this is the same video as in the post. The Daily mail reported that this video recording of the aircraft cabin is on a Saudia Airlines flight from Jeddah. This article was published in 2016.

During our search process, it was found that, earlier, this video was also in circulation alleging that the flight shown in the video belonged to British Airways. AFP FactCheck organisation has written a fact-check article on it.

To summarize, this video doesn’t show an aircraft cabin on Air India flight. It is that of a Saudia Airlines flight.
